Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Maxydog
Reviews.Content: I can't give this place 5 stars because the rooms are simply not that but everything else is. Desk service is great, ask and your question will be answered. Location is in the heart of everything you need to see first time in San Francisco with a bus stop out the front, Cable car two blocks away, and Fisherman's Wharf an easy walk. You have great free Wi-Fi, clean and comfortable rooms with everything you need. There are bars across the street, cafes for breakfast everywhere, and more than enough restaurants of all types within a few blocks. Would I stay here again, you bet I would, why pay twice as much for the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking, Great location, Great View from Columbus street”
Reviews.Author: zzzlynnzzz
Reviews.Content: I love the free parking, you will be guarantee for a parking slot. I love the location, is only minutes walk to Fisherman Wharf, Pier 39, Chinatown, etc... we stayed for 4 nights in 314, thats a king size bed room, with the columbus street view. I love the view from our room, you can see the Coit Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Angebange
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to find this hotel! It had the most comfortable bed, a nice clean room and I could walk nearly everywhere! And the price was great, I paid only $155 a night, in a city where accommodation is pricy. I have recommended it to anyone I know travelling to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Motor Inn for travelers who would never stay in a motor inn.”
Reviews.Author: Rranucci
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent three days and two nights in SF before a weekend workshop at Esalen. The Columbus Motor Inn was our base due to a wise and generous suggestion from Le Boheme up Columbus just 5 or 6 blocks. The room was clean, renovated, quiet, comfortable and tasteful. The two-person desk staff was familial. We walked to City Lights in North Beach, Chinatown and Pier 39 for a Tiburon trip. We caught a comedy showcase of local comedians at the coolest comedy club I've seen, three blocks from this hotel. And the hopping Club Bimbo 365 is close too. Cable cars and buses run by. Walgreens, World Market, Safeway and Starbucks are hidden in a cool brick building two blocks away when you need a taste of home or some bargain stocks. Linens and ice are plentiful. The parking is easy to get and a snap for in and out. I drove by the patrons of the big Union Square hotels and felt sorry for them. Those institutions are Kant- the gemmish little Columbus Motor Inn, all cheap and humble and where it should be - it is a little Kerouac among the giant St. This and St. That. Let's call this hotel the CMI to give it cool. Everybody is welcome because it has what they need. It is a SF experience that opens up many others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTraveler43
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother and sister-in-law, in a 2-bedroom suite. The cost was half what the chain hotels were asking for single rooms. It is within a few blocks of both ghiradelli square and Chinatown. The #30 bus stops right across the street. The cable car is a couple of blocks down the street. These can get you to everything else. Room was clean and comfortable. Service was friendly (would have given five stars, except that we didn't get a replacement light bulb we asked for). Garbage trucks on the street were a bit noisy early in the morning, so an inner room might have helped, but it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Lady_808
Reviews.Content: If you need to mix biz with pleasure, then this is a perfect motel to keep the family happy while ur at conferences and meetings. Free parking at the motel and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf (a few short blocks to two major Cable Car turnarounds at Hyde near Ghiradelli & Taylor streets) made it easy for me to get to my meetings, and for the rest of the family to get around on foot and public trans to major attractions. We bought 3-day passes for $21 each for unlimited rides on the Cable Cars and other public trans... best bargain ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: jlam10
Reviews.Content: This was a cute inn in a perfect location! I was thrilled when I found such a bargain for a place to stay in such an ideal part of the city! We walked to the fishermans wharf and ghiradelli square in just a few minutes. The rooms were clean and spacious. Will def be back the next time i'm in the city!

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM”
Reviews.Author: Pam A
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this hotel....I cannot say 1 thing bad, every was just great....this is such a great deal, you will not be dissappointed. Stay here and save your money. We walked about 3 blocks, purchased a 3day pass that allowed us to ride the muni, the cable cars, city buses, $21.00 for 3 days...the oldest Italian resturant established in 1896, is 2 blocks away. The food was fantastic. You can walk to the Wharf it is that close. The bus stops in front of the hotel. The parking is great, everything was great. The rooms were very nice. This is a basic hotel, nothing fancy, but clean, nice linens, nice bedding, and the location is just great. Also, there are numerous motor inns connected to this one, in other locations in the city. I will always look to motor inns from now on. When I go to SF, I do not need a fancy hotel, I am out looking, shopping, and eating...I will most definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in SF!”
Reviews.Author: my3grls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights last weekend. While this great a deal could be suspect for a big-city hotel ... I believed the ever-trustworthy TripAdvisor reviewers and am SO glad I did! Room was clean, big, nice flat-screen TV, table with chairs, sliding doors and a little balcony, even! The decor, furnishings and fixtures were nice and perfectly adequate. Coffee pot with coffee included; ice machine a few steps down the hall. You can even rent a small fridge for $5 a day. Covered, lighted parking is FREE! Wi-fi is FREE! Our room was on the street side, but other than sirens (which friends in the "inside" rooms heard as well), there was no annoying noise. Columbus Street is Little Italy! Just walk up the street and there are gobs of delightful restaurants, breakfast places, espresso cafes... gelato, truffles, yum :) You're three blocks from Ghirardelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, one block from Starbucks and Trader Joe's, a few blocks from Pier 39, the Alcatraz pier (33), and Chinatown. Pat's Cafe on the next street is great for a hot, traditional breakfast. You can't beat this hotel for a visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Makena1997
Reviews.Content: What a great value! The location is fab- it's an easy walk to the Alcatraz ferry and the wharf, close to the cablecar, close to great dining. We found the room to be very clean, comfortable, quiet and of a decent size. It was in a safe location and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in SF”
Reviews.Author: Clembo1957
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Columbus, when in SF i usually stay at one of the chain hotels at Fisherman's Wharf. I wasn't expecting a great deal but i was pleasantly surprised, for San Francisco the hotel was great value with good rooms, free parking and friendly staff. The hotel is located on Columbus Avenue a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf in one direction and the ItItalaian restaurnats of North Beach in the other. The 30 bus also stops outside the hotel heading down Columbus Ave, Stockton and via China Town to Union Sq. When we checked in the hotel receptionist gave me a quick guided tour of the various exits and entrances ans would probably have shown me around town if i'd asked! The rooms are very clean, my room had two double beds a modern TV and bathroom. Great Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, CLEAN and best location”
Reviews.Author: Princes4me2
Reviews.Content: We requested a room away from the street and were not disappointed. Yes there is a wall about 5 feet away, but this is San Francisco - you dont stay in your room to look out the window. Some of the best food are just South of the hotel. Parking and WI-Fi is free. I'll definitely stay again w/ my family.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: rainlvr
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at chain hotels (Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott) because they are typically consistent in their rooms and standards. I was a little concerned about the Columbus Motor Inn despite all the good reviews. Let me tell you, the excellent reviews are totally on the mark! This place is an absolute gem. When we arrived the guy at the front desk was extremely friendly. The hallway looked as though it had been recently shampooed. Our room (315) was spotless and looked to be recently renovated. Big windows and wonderful views on the Columbus street side, even if you do get some traffic noise (which didn't bother us). The beds were super comfortable with excellent linens. Bathoom was just fine, with good towels, good quality soap/shampoo and was also very clean with reasonable shower pressure. Our room also had two beautiful flat screen TV's and wifi that worked very well. Location is outstanding, plus they have free parking. It is walking distance to tons of restaurants, fishermen's wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, as well as the famous Lombard street. If I had to say anything negative at all it would be that I'd like a little more lighting in the room, but the lighting was still perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: TMPSEATVLR
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Columbus Motor Inn. It is in a good location, just a block from the more expensive Fisherman's Wharf hotels. We walked to the Coit Tower, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf (5 min.) and even back from Union Square one nice day. The rooms are nicely furnished, including a table and flat screen TV, and the bathrooms are large and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful, parking is included in the room rate. Breakfast is not included, but the front desk recommended Pat's Cafe around the corner and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: suppressor86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in early January 2012. The location of this place is fantastic. It's close to Fisherman's Wharf, and the parking in the garages is easy. The lobby staff recommended several good restaurants, and we never had any trouble. Definitely request a quiet room away from the street for a peaceful night's rest!

Reviews.Title: “3rd Stay Here and Still Like It”
Reviews.Author: EssieSgp
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay here. We stayed in a 1 King 1 Queen room. The room is spacious room with the king bed is located in the main area while the queen bed in a separate room. It's nice to have a small dinning table with chairs on top of the usual furniture. As mentioned in other posts, there is no parking charge. It is conveniently located within walking distance to starting point of Powell-Mason cable car, Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, Pier 33 for Alcatraz Cruises. Bus #30 can be taken in front of the inn to take you to Chinatown. Pat's cafe is just round the corner we ate breakfast there 3 days in a row. I requested for a quiet room and got one that faces an internal courtyard. I guess one cannot ask for quietness and view at the same time here. Will stay here again if I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights and it was wonderful. Close to the trolleys - 1 1/2 blocks; buses right out the front door, the wharf just blocks away. Rooms were nice and clean. In fact I was very pleased with the cleaniness and size of the rooms. Great staff to help answer any of your questions. we were at the alley entrance and one night it got loud cuz of the bar across the alley but didn't keep us awake at all. would definitely stay here on our next trip back to SF and will definitely tell others to stay there. we had beautiful weather for December in fact the taxi guy said he should drive us to Las Vegas cuz we were so lucky. The tour bus was also a great deal. Be sure to get a weekly pass for trolleys that includes trolleys and buses - can't go wrong with it and if you don't use all of it pass it onto someone else to finish it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, free parking plenty of room.”
Reviews.Author: happydaze-7
Reviews.Content: A good choice. Clean and comfortable with free parking a bonus. No real concierge service, rooms are reasonable. About 3 blocks from fishermans wharf and close to transport. Make sure you get a room off the street as it can be noisy. Would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. would never go back”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaMary
Reviews.Content: . We chose this hotel based on the reviews on TA and its location to the wharf. We wanted somewhere within a few minutesâ€™ walk to the wharf and reasonably priced. This seemed to fit that description, and it was all those things. But in this case it was a matter of â€˜you get what you pay forâ€™ My first impressions as I entered the foyer late at night after a longish flight were not very favourable. The concierge barely looked at us, handed as the key without taking his eyes off whatever he was doing. When we got to our room it was not any better. The room was old, tacky dirty and smelly. When we left the next morning to start exploring, the morning desk person was slightly friendlier, if at all. One would not rely on their help, guidance or advice regarding tourist attractions, cafÃ©s, restaurants, tours etc. If you know San Francisco relatively well and all you want is a place to sleep, this hotel may be sufficient. However, if you want clean and friendly I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking free parking free parking”
Reviews.Author: phil7101
Reviews.Content: The big advantage of staying here, is of course the free parking. When I was looking at hotels in Fisherman's Wharf, just about every other hotel in the area was charging up to $45 per day for parking. I ended up paying $82 (plus tax) for the room with parking, it would have easily been over $200 total for any other hotel. The room itself was clean, average size, with a flatscreen tv. Front rooms have a good view of the city with Coit tower visible. It's pretty much a no-frills stay, but good value and it's within walking distance of the Wharf and cable car stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Oztwinkletoes
Reviews.Content: Great value for a great location! Rooms are big and spacious, bathroom is a great size. All rooms come with free wifi which is fantastic, and there is free parking (which we didn't need). If you don't have a car you can catch a bus right at the front or you can walk the short walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Additionally if you want to ride a bike around the city there is a place next door that rents them. The staff are quite friendly and helpful for when asking questions about the city. If we do go back to San Francisco in the future we will return! Thanks for the great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great location with free parking”
Reviews.Author: Jim&Jane
Reviews.Content: While some of the furniture is dated, the rooms were recently updated, comfortable with new beds and flat screen TVs. Has free wi-fi. Our room did not have a microwave or refrigerator which would have been nice. But rooms are a great value. We had a great stay and will go back for sure. The only reason for not an "excellent" rating was the lack of fridge and micro. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. Location is very convenient on Columbus Ave in North Beach. Bus stop right there. Only a couple of blocks to Safeway and Trader Joes.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable & convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Trace123NewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with 3 adults and 2 kids, booking a suite with a separate queen bed and a king/rollaway bed in the main room. The room was plenty big enough for the 5 of us and one of the quietest rooms we've stayed in in a big city. We had room 313 and even though the hotel is located next to a big nightclub we heard no noise either Saturday or Sunday night. There was no view from our room, but this didn't worry us at all, we were happy to wait for the great views when we stepped outside. With only a very short walk to the cable car turnaround, a short walk to supermarket/Walgreens/grocery store and a pleasant stroll to Fishermans' Wharf and Pier 39 (even my 71 year old mother-in-law could handle it) this hotel was extremely well situated. Friendly and helpful staff and a really big bonus in San Francisco - Free covered parking!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Kerry C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a two room suite. This was perfect for our family of 4, as the kids had their own bedroom with 2 queen beds, and our bedroom was a queen and had a balcony too. It was a really nice suite, with a great view (rm 315). We could see Alcatraz, Coit tower and had glimpses of the bay. It was a few blocks to Fishermans Wharf, and we used the cable cars and the 30 bus several times. We also used Blazing Saddles bike hire next door one day. I really liked this hotel, great value, great location and friendly staff. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate for a comfortable room near tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: trevandash
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly and a great rate including parking in downtown San Francisco. Joe at the front desk was extremely helpful! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Columbus Motor Inn Makes Sense”
Reviews.Author: jjojr
Reviews.Content: The Columbus Motor Inn has everything you need to enjoy San Francisco at a reasonable price. Clean rooms, convienient location, and free on-site parking are just a few of its advantages.

Reviews.Title: “best deal in SF!”
Reviews.Author: gavin g
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are form the Napa Valley and wanted to do a "Staycation" in the City(SF). After some research and advice from friends we found Columbus Motor Inn. For that location, in the middle of North Beach and Fishermans wharf this place was a steal. The Inn itself is an older building, but very clean and well maintained. We both felt very safe and the parking was free. This isnt a world class place, but for what you pay youcan not beat it. There is nothing in the City this good. 4/5 stars, only thing was older building.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: havealredy10
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at the columbus motor inn. the location was great for our stay in the city. we enjoyed the room very much, it was clean and big and the bed was comfortable. we stayed on the street side and I loved watching the city go by. Loved the fact that we had free parking, and still were able to walk a lot of the places that we wanted to go. We will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok!”
Reviews.Author: AnasRockworld
Reviews.Content: Not the best place but it works. The rooms are big and clean. The staff wasn't very friendly tho. Our room was just in front of the Indian restaurant/Pub and it was quite noisy at night + some people had like a party or something like that inside the hotel so it was like we were with them in the same room. The good this is: the place is very close to downtown, there's a lot of good restaurants around (including the indian restaurant across the street). The price is fine for a place to go to sleep & keep your stuff while you are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: audionut98
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Columbus Motor Inn for my San Francisco visit, based on the many positive reviews on the hotel. I have to say that I was not disappointed. In fact, I very much agree with all the positive points written about it, as my stay there was very pleasant. The front desk staff, especially Joe, was very helpful. The room that I booked was a 2 bedroom suite, and its very spacious. The beds' mattresses are by Serta, as mentioned by the hotel in the website, most comfortable. Had no problem sleeping. The room amenities are great (picture big screen LCD TV in each of the bedrooms, as well as free high speed internet access and car parking. Also, there are free apples everyday at the front desk for guests to munch. So, any areas to improve on or to note? Well, there is no fridge in the room, and I think the window panes are a little thin, as we can hear all traffic that pass by our room Other than that, it is now my favourite hotel in San Francisco, and I will stay there again when I visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here several times”
Reviews.Author: R0llTider
Reviews.Content: We have made several visits to San Francisco. We always stay at the Columbus Motor Inn. It is in a great location, good people, and Free Parking. It is always clean and easy to get into and out.

Reviews.Title: “Location!! Location!! Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasWatergirl
Reviews.Content: Near Wharf, cable cars, public transportation, restaurants!! Got friendly assistance every day for directions and advice! Our room 307 was huge! King size bed! Very clean! Great bed! Shower pressure was nice! Quiet on third floor! We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: nottmlango
Reviews.Content: family of 4 with 2 lads aged 16/14. had a 1 bedroom suite on 3rd floor facing Columbus. No issues with the noise. Apartment clean & free wifi worked without issue. Front office staff not overly talkative but when questions were posed they answered them all. Great location for the wharf. Pats Cafe around the corner great for breakfast. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: evapor8
Reviews.Content: Another random hotel pick for my USA trip, as we were trying avoid paying the prices offered by the bigger hotel chains for the same area. We stayed 4 nights in two double queen adjoining rooms. The wifi was free and worked well in our first floor rooms. There was free parking (which we only used for an hour before we dropped our convertible Mustangs back to the rental office.) The people on the front desk were all very helpful. We had a hit list of things to do whilst in SF (Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Oakland Raiders NFL game not to mention a bit of drinking!) and they offered advice on some good places to go and the best transport routes to take. There's no dining options at the hotel, which isn't a problem as there are literally hundreds of places to eat in the Fisherman's Wharf area. The rooms were quiet, cleaned daily, and the beds were amazingly comfortable. I was very happy with this hotel selection. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel w/Free Parking in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ctheworld88
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel/motel. This time was for our daughter's graduation. To be fair, this is really more of a motel, but the rooms are very clean, and the parking is free. Free parking in SF is virtually nonexistent, and considering you'll pay between $40 & $70 to park your car, this is a major savings. The location is very convenient to North Beach & Fisherman's Wharf for restaurants and sightseeing. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Brad D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the reviews on Trip Advisor. Some I agree, some not so much. Clean & good price for being close to fisherman's wharf. Small parking stalls. Not too friendly front desk people. Real noisy for rooms facing Columbus. Get a room facing back or be ready for the street noise. We heard that but took a chance, hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location and Parking Included”
Reviews.Author: frothygirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at the Columbus, having just arrived from Australia. The hotel is on a busy road, but our room was quiet and very comfortable. The bed was also extremely comfortable. The hotel is ideally located for tourists between North Beach and Fishermasn wharf - allowing walking distance to most of the key sights in San Francisco. Parking is included in the cost which is a huge bonus. The hotel looks a bit tired from the outside, but our room was clean and tidy. 1 of the reception staff was a bit surly however the other was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Diane4565
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything other reviewers have written...great location (4 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, short bus ride to North Beach (Little Italy) and Chinatown). We had a rental car and the free parking was a definite plus! Our room was clean, comfortable and the hotel staff were courteous and informative. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff and Debbie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn for 3 nights while in San Francisco for the Nike Women's Marathon. We traveled with 2 of our teen daughters. We really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Our room (#315) was spacious (2 room suite with 1 queen and 2 double beds) and very clean. There is a table / sitting area in the main room and both rooms have a closet, a dresser, and a large flat-screen TV. There is one bathroom with the sink located outside of the separate shower / tub and toilet room. There is a balcony off of the bedroom that faces Columbus Ave. There was noticable street noise with the sliding door open, but the room was nice and quiet to sleep with the door closed. The location of the hotel is fantastic - we arrived Friday afternoon and departed Monday morning and did not use our vehicle at all. We used busses, the cable cars, and the light rail to travel all over the city. There is a bus stop for Line #30 right in front of the hotel and you can catch a cable car 2 blocks away. Pick up a transit map / guide and you can get anywhere in the city fairly easily. Next time we travel to San Francisco we will definitely stay at the Columbus Motor Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Columbus Inn”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn a couple of years ago, so when we passed through San Fran on Sept 30 & Oct 1, we booked here again. Can't beat the price, especially with parking included. We had a king room that was equiped for the disabled, so that was a little different. We were on the lower floor, so the room had a bit of a musty smell. Tried to move to a higher floor, and were told they were totally booked, but might be able to get moved the next day. It wasn't bad enough to bother moving, so we just sprayed some cologne.Would stay here again, just request an upper floor. Great location in the city, we walked to everything.

Reviews.Title: “still a great place”
Reviews.Author: We_L0ve_Italy
Reviews.Content: stayed here a few years ago. The hotel has been updated and is a great find for the price. Free parking, and a friendly helpful front desk staff make it a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “AAA recommended, so we tried it 20 years ago”
Reviews.Author: BOBALOU06
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best little hotels we have ever stayed at. We have travelled to all 50 states, and for price and convenience this is by far one of the best for a large city tourist destination. Yes there is no pool, food, or great foyer, but who cares. The rates are excellent and the parking is FREE! There is a bus stop in front, and the hotel is in very easy walking distance to all Fisherman's Wharf attractions. Stay here you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems but......”
Reviews.Author: NY Rangers
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi was horrendous and it has no frig or microwave in the room but it was clean, cheap and so convenient to everything-the terminus of the Mason-Powell cable car is a short 1 & 1/2 blocks and the #30 bus stops outside the front door. Parking was plentiful and inside the building. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure in this very expensive town”
Reviews.Author: Hooked_on_travel77
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure we could afford San Francisco anymore with ultra high hotel prices and insane parking fees but thanks to TripAdvisor we found this gem of a place. Shall we start with covered free parking? This is truly different and a huge plus in this city. Be warned though that the parking slots are on the small side. The front desk clerks were very nice and helpful with pleasant demeanors. We had asked for a quiet room and we were not disappointed with room #309. No views but no concern to us as we had views everywhere else in the city during our 3 night stay. The room was very clean with no odors and it was quite comfortable and roomy overall. No 'rundown' feeling at all. Everything is within walking distance and we never moved our car once until we checked out. We can't complain about one thing except the elevator which seems to be on it's last legs. We would highly recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: MrsNCFC
Reviews.Content: Having been to San Fan before we knew we wanted to dump the car and get around by foot/tram and this hotel with free parking was absolutely perfect. Easy parking and check in. The room was totally adequate and modern with usual access to modern tv, ice machine etc. Bed was really comfy, room was quiet and the shower pressure was good which is all I need in a hotel. We had a rear facing room with views to Coit Tower, America Building and the church Madonna married in - as well as the neighbouring night club which we did not hear at all. Location makes this hotel. As others say it is 5 mins to the tram stop and Fisherman's Wharf and this is no exaggeration. If you love fish then eat down on the wharf. If you love cheesecake then head for the Cheesecake factory at the top of macy's in the city centre. Hubby loves cheesecake so that is where we headed - it is awesome!!! Just make sure you don't have 2 courses before your dessert as you will not have room for it - we always go main OR starter instead of both as American portions are gigantic. Really good value for money although beer is pricey everywhere in the US so soft drinks with free refills did the job for me (pregnant too so no real choice!). Recommend: do the night tour of Alcatraz - eerie but superb. Walk the crooked road (Lombard St.) and down the wharf. Eat at Fog City Diner for brekkie and then walk up to Coit Tower. Recommend : get a travel pass so you can use any city transport - well worth it. Do the hop on/hop off bus across the Golden Gate Bridge - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel ! Easy 5 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf and tram terminal, 10 minute walk to the Crooked Street and surrounded by bars and eateries. We stayed in room 315 a family of 5 (3 tennagers 2adults) and had plenty of room, 3 queen beds, 2 rooms !. The rooms have glimpses of the bay and views of some famous landmarks, 1 of the rooms has a balcony. Overall I would definitely stay here again, we loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ricejunk
Reviews.Content: The Columbus Motor may not offer the best views from some of the rooms, but it is very reasonable for it's location. The desk staff were very helpful with directions to restaurants, sights, and bars. It has all that you need and a bit more. Flat panel Tvs, free parking and easy check ins made this a nice inn. I would definitely consider staying here again. A business center would be nice just for printing off boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Tawinters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a vacation with friends. Was within a couple blocks of all the major San Francisco sights. Found out after we got to the hotel that they have a shuttle to the airport and have free parking. We took the BART and then a bus which dropped us off across the street from the hotel. Beds were comfortable. Bathrooms were a little old but still decent. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better? Fairly clean, still great location and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPenguin
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Columbus Motor Inn, and I was less impressed this time. We stayed for four nights in October 2010. Pros: Front desk staff is still friendly, parking is still free (though not overly abundant), and the location cannot be beat - walking distance to so much you'd want to see in San Francisco. Some rooms have a Coit Tower view. Cons: Very outdated rooms (it seems like only the TV has been updated since the '80s), shabby bedding, not as stringent about the cleanliness as I experienced in the past (not like we found used Band-Aids around, but not great, and one day housekeeping did not even show up though we left the room early in the day). The bathroom is very outdated and dark. We only had one request for the front desk (we were missing our "Do not disturb" sign), and though the desk was friendly, we never got our sign. One last note that kept alarming us: If someone entered the room next to us, it REALLY sounded like they were coming into our room. Kind of freaky until we got accustomed to it. I would still stay at the Columbus Motor Inn for the value, relative cleanliness, free parking, and amazing location, but it would no longer be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price make this an outstanding choice”
Reviews.Author: RichmondTraveler55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn while visiting my adult daughter in San Francisco. This hotel is not fancy, but the rooms are generously sized, spotlessly clean, and the management is helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, and arranging shuttle service to the airport. The location is just two blocks from a trolley car stop, and just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, and all the waterfront attractions. Although I did not have a car, parking is available at the hotel. This is an ideal choice for a comfortable hotel in a great location at an extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent For the Money”
Reviews.Author: Wmstrop
Reviews.Content: The best things about this property are the location and the free parking. Just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf it is very east to get to all the touristy things San Francisco has to offer. Cable Car and bus connections are all within a few blocks and, if you're a walker, you won't even need the mass transportation. The free parking enables those that rent a car to get out of town to see some of the scenic attractions up the coast such as Muir Woods and Point Reyes and not have to worry about the cost and near impossibility of finding a parking space upon your return. The rooms are fairly spacious and clean although there are no decorations to speak of to spruce the place up. There is a large screen TV in the room which is nice but the picture is not in HD if that is something you care about. And the clock radio has a CD player built in. The bathroom and shower are likewise clean and roomy. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and helpful. The only thing the room could have used was a mini-fridge. For the money you will spend and the location it would be very hard to beat the Columbus Motor Inn. Additionally for those in search of a good restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner I heartily recommend Pat's Cafe which is just a block away on Taylor Street.

Reviews.Title: “Two words BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Burma L
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in mid August. The major CON: Came home with bed bugs! Other cons - grimy, broken ice machine, free parking, but not enough spots available, and expensive for what you get. Again bed bugs! The postive is for the service - nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Close to Fishermans Warf”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip advisor, I booked the Columbus Motor Inn in downtown SF. Don't relay on the website for accurate room information. I checked on-line and the website said they were booked. I phoned the hotel directly and was able to make a reservation over the phone. We arrived late aprox (10 PM) and our room was ready. Nothing fancy but clean. Our room was a little dated but everything worked fine. We booked a room with 2 Queen beds for a family of four. Plenty of room for all of us and one of the only hotels I could find with queen beds. Free Parking was a big benefit in downtown SF. We were able to park the car at the hotel and walk to Fisherman's warf, the Alcatraz Ferry and the cable cars are only two blocks away. We asked the front desk for a recommendation for breakfast and they suggested "Pats Cafe" which is a short couple block walk. This isd a curte hole in the wall cafe serving breakfast, lunch and dinner at very reasonable prices considering they are in downtown. If you're looking for nive ammenaties and a lobby area to hang out in, I would not book here. If you're looking for a great location and a comfortable place to sleep. Try here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value. Free parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: matsoc
Reviews.Content: The room was big and the queen beds were comfortable. There was a good view on Columbus Street. The furniture is not luxurious, but feels solid. The bathroom was a bit tiny but clean. The location is almost excellent: you just have to walk five minutes to go to the heart of North Beach, the italian quarter, full of restaurants and one of the best location to sleep in San Francisco. You can find the best Espresso there.. and a lot of great places for breakfast! (there is no breakfast in the motel). The elevator could a little crowded at morning, if you are in hurry, take the stairs! A nice motel in a great district!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: lecorio
Reviews.Content: I was at the columbus last december with my family and it was a very nice stay. Mr Oscar was always helpful on the front desk, giving us good tips about transportations and, specially, places to eat, all near and very good. This is a simple hotel, small, without the foolish things that make others expensive, at least in my oppinion. Free parking was great and the room very conf. The only thing not nice was the weather, very rainy, but what can we do? Hope we can go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location and free parking”
Reviews.Author: utripmeplease
Reviews.Content: This place was great for our purposes. San Francisco has very upscale, historical, beautiful hotels...this is not one of those. BUT, it is a really great value. The room is clean and large. The beds are comfy. We had a view of Coit Tower, the Transamerica building and the Cathedral and Bimbo's (next door) was not a noise problem at all (although I am sure no one was playing when we were there). The cable car stop is one short block away and Fisherman's Wharf is three short blocks away. Did I mention free parking? I would stay here again, and will most likely do so soon. I love that town!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to attractiions”
Reviews.Author: kayotic_81
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of doing attractions in the San Fran area such as Golden Gate Bridge, and or Alcatraz, this inn was in good walking distance of these attractions. The best part about this inn was parking was free! The rooms were in good conditions, spacious and there was a small dining table. I found the inn to be slightly outdated, the elevators and rooms had a slight odor. Overall a good place to stay, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Brucie13
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to mostly everything! Very spacious and clean room. Free parking. We had a room on the third floor and the view was very nice. Just loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: castlerock10
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the third floor in the two bedroom suite with a step-out balcony facing Columbus Avenue for 2 nights beginning on July 3rd. Then we moved to the back side of the hotel to another suite on the second floor only because I added a 3rd night and my original room was already booked. If you are a light sleeper which I'm not, I recommend you ask for a room not facing Columbus Avenue. I experienced both sides of the hotel and didn't have a problem sleeping but my wife did wake up the first night to what she described as the sound of a motorcycle with a busted tail pipe. Our rooms were very spacious, clean, and comfortable. At night we had a great view of the city and Coit Tower from the room facing Columbus Avenue. Overall, this hotel is in a great location. It is blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car turn stations. By the way the Columbus Motor Inn has parking included with your stay. Although we drove to San Francisco (and then eventually down PCH ï�Š) during our stay we decided to keep our vehicle parked and use the many options of public transportation. We bought the three day Muni-Pass which includes the cable cars. With Muni Route 30 right in front of the hotel it was convenient to board and transfer to other routes so we explored the entire city. We hopped on and went to Union Square, China Town, AT&T Park for a game, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alamo Square just to name a few. Next time we're in San Francisco, we will definitely stay at the Columbus Motor Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghHardcritic
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were patient, kind and helpful. They offered suggestions and direction help to get the library, MUNI and cable car services. The hotel is in a great location for short walks to shopping, cable cars, wharf attractions and grocery stores-Safeway & Trader Joes. The rooms were basic, but had the necessary amentities-tv, comfy bed, tub & shower & small table to sit. My only wish was for a micro or refridge for the price. My room was facing the buildings, but no matter as not in the room very long except to sleep. Also near the ice machine & elevator, but did not hear either frequently to cause any disruption in sleep/quiet. The free parking was great also-got the last spot! Another guest right behind me & they took his keys to park his car. Allowed me to keep car there until 1- 2pm after check-out. There are quite a few spaces on the street, but the meter price is ridiculous!!-1 minute for a nickel. Observed a lot of families with kids at the hotel. Heard a few "running feet" in the hallways, but no shouting or disruptive behavior. Just mentioning this, for those with small kids. About a 10-15 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 33 for trips to Alcatraz. Overall a fantastic place to stay and would definitely recommend to anyone on a budget who wants a "high-class" place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLH01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely spacious rooms with balconies, great service and more importantly a fantastic location in San Francisco. It's minutes walk from the Wharf and right on Columbus which is full of great bars and restaurants. Be sure to visit Trader Joe's just 2 blocks away and the cable car!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: Elarbolita
Reviews.Content: Our first room smelled like deodorizer covering cigarette smoke, so we asked to see another room. The third room we saw did not smell bad. The decor was tired, the mattresses were hard, and the shower head was like a fire hose. The view (room 301) was lovely and the staff did their best to help us when we were unhappy with the first room. The location was fantastic, close to Fisherman's Wharf, City Lights Bookstore, and many wonderful restaurants. But we will remember not to stay here again because it just wasn't that pleasant. It took my husband an hour to get the Free High Speed Internet going. He had to talk to Tech Support on the phone. The Support guys were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, FREE parking!”
Reviews.Author: elmarto1
Reviews.Content: My wife and 16 year old son stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn for three nights beginning July 12th. We attempted to make reservations about 5 weeks prior to our arrival but their website said that they were booked and no rooms were available. After reading other reviews on tripadvisor I saw that others encountered the same problem but called the hotel directly and were able to get a room. Same experience here - I called them and got the room that we needed. Checkin was very easy and the parking was FREE. We later learned just how rare this is in SF. We were given room #201, which faced Columbus Ave. We had a view of the street but it was not noisy at night. The bathroom overlooked the lane and side door of Bimbo's 365; a nightclub with quite a history. Again, not noisy at night. The room itself was not what I would call fancy, but who cares. It was clean and it was within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, and Lombard St. On our first night we asked the front desk clerk for a good Chinese restaurant in the area and he recommeded Brandy Ho's about 8 blocks down Columbus Ave. We went there and it was fabulous (another review). We found that there were plenty of dining options in the area but decided to stop by Trader Joe's to pick up some random items like bottled water and some snacks that we could carry with us. The Columbus Motor Inn served as a great base of operations while we explored all of the attractions in the area: Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, the Embarcadero, AT&T Park, the Golden Gate Bridge, Lombard St. We walked to all but the Golden Gate and AT&T Park. (Took ferry to Alcatraz obviously but the location to get on the ferry is fairly close to the hotel). We found the hotel to be secure and we never saw any questionable types hanging around. After exploring the area we discovered that the Columbus Motor Inn was pretty much on par with any of the other hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Most of them are fairly small with no frills. The thing that sets this hotel apart is the free parking and location. It is fairly equidistant to most of the attractions. I understand that people have varying expectations when they stay at a hotel. We usually stay at Marriotts, Sheratons, or Hyatts so we weren't sure about the place before checking in. In the end it turned out to be just fine and we are happy that we stayed there. We plan to go back to SF next year and we plan to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking was the key”
Reviews.Author: photoqueenmn
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 3) were here for a conference at the Moscone Center. We stayed here due to the price and the free parking. The rooms were fine, clean and big, but no morning breakfast. We did ride the bus into the Center each morning-picked up right outside the hotel. The location is great for walking from the hotel to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, and restaurants. Also great for jumping in the car and heading out to other areas of SF and beyond. I recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a great location, at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Northern California road trip. I picked it based on price, TA reviews, and free parking. The room is standard but perfectly fine and very clean. The location is just perfect for all San Francisco sightseeing. We walked from the hotel to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, and all our restaurants (most of which were located right in North Beach). I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a great location, at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchOne
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be close to Fisherman's Wharf, but didn't want to pay for the parking. That's when I discovered Columbus Motor Inn. When we arrived, there was one space left to park the car. I asked what if it was full, they replied to double park the car,give them the keys and they'll fix it when someone leaves. I didn't use the car the whole vacation, but I think they have less parkingspaces than rooms. Anyway, I think it's a five minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and about a 10-15 minute walk to Pier 33 for the Alcatraz Cruise. Walk down one block and then you're already at Lombard Street. Takes about a few minutes to climb up to the most crookedest part of the street and gives a nice few of North Beach. The cable car is one block to the east. One way ride costs you 5 dollar, all day pass 13 dollars. This will get you onto Union Square and Market Street in no time. I wouldn't recommend walking all the way to there, the cablecar is so much easier. Rooms were big enough, I loved the big TV and liked the in-room safe. We requested a room on Columbus Ave, but got one on the side. No problem. Didn't had any noise problems, could sleep without any problem. Requested a refridgerator, but it wasn't in the room, so they placed it the other day. Wifi was a problem though. Signal was fine but I couldn't get my Asus EeePC nor my iPod Touch 4G online using wifi. Luckily there was also a LAN cable located behind the nightstand, so I could still use my netbook. For breakfast, try Pat's Cafe. It's behind the int. sportsbar on Taylor Street. Also, don't forget to bike the Golden Gate bridge!

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: TeriR_11
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Francisco recently with my sister and best friend to celebrate my completion of chemotherapy treatment. Based on reviews we found at TripAdvisor we booked a suite at the Columbus Motor Inn. What a find! The location at the edge of North Beach was terrific, the rooms were clean and nicely furnished and the free parking was awesome. The staff member at the front desk was very helpful with recommendations for dining within walking distance, directions, etc. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Natasja1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June. Our satnav easily found the hotel and praking was free, which is a major bonus in San Fran. We had requested a room at the back to avoid street noise and the request was honored. It is a noisy hotel though, because the walls are thin and you can indeed hear people in neighbouring rooms but I must say that this didn't disturb our sleep (and we're retty light sleepers). It's definately a no frills hotel & the rooms are pretty basic. The bathroom could do with a lick of paint, but the bed was big and comfortable. There was also a safety deposit box which was very convenient and most importantly, the room was clean. The free WIFI worked just fine and we were in a room on the third floor, at the back (so quite far fom the reception). The hotel's about 10mins walk from the Wharf, and about 45mins from Union Square. All in all a great hotel for a city trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: sleepyjuli
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at this hotel and once again we were not disappointed. We had a two bedroom suite this time and it was large and clean. Parking is free (which is hard to find in SF) and the hotel also has free WiFi. Our room faced Columbus Ave. but it wasn't noisy at all. The location is excellent. You can walk to Fisherman's Wharf and it is also really close to the cable car stop. Pat's Cafe on Taylor Street (just off Columbus) is a great place for breakfast. We'll definitely be staying at this hotel again next time we come to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Rayray26
Reviews.Content: In hind sight we should have asked to be moved after the first night, but we thought our neighbours might be checking out! Initial worries over nightclub we overlooked unfounded as club only opens Fri/Sat and we stayed Mon-Thur, however the thin Walls mean noisy neighbours can be heard clearly and opening and shutting of room doors is very annoying. We were in a corner room between kids/parents (why they didn't offer them an adjoining rooms that the internal door could be used I don't know) and they were constantly going from one room to another! Front desk staff were generally courteous and helpful and the hotel is in a great location for exploring the city with bike rental places close by and easy access to the cable cars and nonproblem exploring from here on foot. Reasonably priced compared to others in similar area but not for light sleepers!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: sasha079
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice is how close all the big expensive hotels are to this hotel. A few are around the corner in Bay Street. Bay Street is your access point to the local supermarkets (both Trader Joes and Safeway are 5 minutes away). Also at the bottom of Bay Street is the cable car route. Lombard Street is 5 minutes walk away from the hotel, so you can make a quick visit to the world most crooked street late in the day. Onsite parking is a little tight, but you can park your car for the whole of your San Francisco trip and get around by foot and cable car. We found a good Patagonia shop nearby and a bike hire shop is only a few doors away. Nice big room and some really good photos out of the bathroom window. Only complaints..No Fridge...they will hire you one for $5 a day but really guys why not just supply one. Also the bald chap on reception could do with some customer service lessons, a smart mouth is a not a nice welcome especially when you have a young child. Yes we would stay here again, it was central to everything and being able to call in at the supermarket and bottleshop on the way home from alcatraz or shopping downtown is great. The safeway opens early so you can get breakfast makings here, they also sell some really nice plastic bowls and plates which we brought home with us.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FIND IN SAN FRAN!”
Reviews.Author: romancatm
Reviews.Content: Last year, we took a family cross-country trip and San Francisco was one of the places that was on our "to-see" list. We were driving from Chicago, all the way to Cali, and had many stops on the way, so as you can imagine, I certainly did my research for hotels for quite some time before we left. Based on previous reviews, we decided to give the Columbus Motor Inn a chance. And I can easily say that it was the right choice. We were looking for somewhere that offered parking as part of the our stay and the Columbus offers it for FREE. In this economy, you cant get better than that! San Francisco was our longest stay - 5 days, 4 nights. Not only is the Columbus Motor Inn in the PERFECT location, but the people working at the desk are a pleasure as well and very helpful. "the Crooked street" is blocks away, fishermans wharf is a ten minute walk away, theres many great restaurants in the area - we stopped at a chicken place (Il Pollaio - the BEST chicken i've EVER had) and I had sushi at a little corner place while my parents stopped at the local market to pick up some fruits and bread for the rest of the trip. We had a corner room on the second floor and it was EXTREMELY spacious, newly renovated, very clean, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was great too! Good water pressure, and the soap smelled nice. So if you're looking for a great, affordable place to stay while visiting San Francisco that is withing walking distance of everything, go with Columbus Motor Inn! You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KahylaNoosaHeads
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at this hotel after reading many reviews of hotels in San Francisco, based on price, location and positive reviews. We were not disappointed, we had a two room suite, and were very pleased with it as it was comfortable, clean and quiet, the free parking was a bonus, as hotels in San Francisco normally charge high fees for parking. Close to Cable Cars, Safeways, Trader Joes and Fishermans Wharf are all within in comfortable and safe walking distance. We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone as the perfect place for a stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: pa_kelly17
Reviews.Content: After reading various reviews on trip advisor about hotels in san francisco we decided on booking a family room at the Columbus Motor Inn and we are so glad we did. The location could not have been better, it was an easy walk to fishermans wharf, the cable cars, a supermarket and bus transport to the city was right outside the front. Price for the unit was more then reasonable. Front desk were helpful and your rooms were cleaned and towels changed each day. We had a front unit so there was a bit of traffic noise but it was never an issue. I would recommend this hotel and if we do get back to this fantastic city will definitely stay here again. Additionally, free parking and internet. Oh and try the Indian Restaurant across the road, very good value and food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!! Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: ATX455
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Reasonable rates. Close to all the San Francisco tourist spots. Mere blocks away from Lombard St.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: memecoleman
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this page. We were very happy with out choice. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom. The parking was a little tight for our big truck. However, parking was free. We can't complain. All the staff was friendly and helpful. Near North Beach and Little Italy. Not at all afraid to walk around the neighborhood. Very good value for downtown San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: karmill_8
Reviews.Content: Not fancy and a little worn, but clean and comfortable. Free parking is great, if a little cramped. Our room overlooked Bimbo's, the club next door. One night I heard the bass from the club at night, but it wasn't enough to keep me awake, especially with the comfortable beds. Other than that, it was very quite. As other reviewers have stated, the location is great. I'm an early riser and took morning walks to Fisherman's Wharf as the city was just waking up, stopping at McDonalds or Starbucks for coffee on my way back. (That's not to say anything is wrong with the in-room coffee.) Also found a wonderful breakfast place nearby, Hollywood Cafe. Friendly service and good food, we ate there twice during our stay. Trader Joe's is nearby too, great and affordable place to pick up snacks and wine. We didn't have much contact with the staff, but they seemed pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: johal789
Reviews.Content: The best location you could ever get at a reasonable price. Free parking. There's no breakfast, but then it's so close to everywhere. I would definitely go there again. The only flip side was that the internet never really worked for me in the room, so i had to go downstairs and sit in the reception to get proper signal

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values we experienced on our trip to Bay To Breakers.”
Reviews.Author: mobywile
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise this Motor Inn was. Nice, clean, spacious room, with great coffee in the room. Close to everything we wanted to do in North Beach and also handy to the "F" Line transport to the Embarcadero and Financial District. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. I think we dealt with 4 different fron desk staff and they were all great. We had a room on the 3rd floor on Columbus and it was great. Very little street noise, and a view from Marin to Coit Tower. We will stay here more nights the next time we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: jamesandjamie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights based on reviews from Travel Advisor. The rooms were clean, and roomy. The location was perfect. The free parking was a bargain! Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay there if all you need is simple comforts”
Reviews.Author: QueensLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of our trip up the coast of California. The room was clean and roomy and the location was perfect. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. We had a late flight the following day and they let us stay in their parking lot until 3:00PM. The only down side was street noise from the nearby clubs, but it was a Friday night and it didn't continue too long. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJean
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Francisco...and booked this hotel on the reviews from TripAdvisor. When ever we go to a location that we have not visited before we always turn to TripAdvisor. The location was perfect. Minutes from the Wharf, North Beach, Ghiradelli Square, crooked street, China Town and much more. Saturday at the Ferry building is a great and I mean great Farmer's Market, lots of organic fruits and vegetables....with free samples galore. Lots of food vendors and other specialty items. It is a 20 to 30 minutes walk from the Columbus Inn or you can take the Street Car for two dollars from the Wharf. We took a Wine Country tour that we absolutely enjoyed by Tower Tours that can be arranged from the front desk or by calling 866-345-8687 or 415-345-8687. It was $75.00 per person no tax and they pick you up in front of the Columbus Inn. We toured three winery's...and had lunch in a quaint little town in Napa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the budget conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: Lola_Von_Skilet
Reviews.Content: If your traveling on a budget and looking for a nice, clean hotel with free parking, the Columbus Motor Inn is great. I've stayed in Union Square before and let me tell you that is one scarey part of town after dark. The location of the Columbus Motor Inn is perfect! It's only three blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars and the heart of North Beach. Public transportation is incredible in SF and there is a bus stop right outside the inn. I was not at all nervous walking in North Beach at all at night even with my kids. The staff was very nice. If staying on a budget is a factor for you, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Clean, Comfortable, Excellent and Helpful Front Staff”
Reviews.Author: bclooch
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel near Fishermans Wharf. The front desk was extremely helpful especially Noah. They took care of reservations for some local tours. Suggested places to eat. The room was clean and comfortable a tribute to the house keeping staff. I would stay here again when I return to San Francisco. We found this location through the Auto Club and I would recommend it without hesitation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: SweetCountryWoman
Reviews.Content: We can confirm all the positive comments: great location, free parking, spacious and clean rooms (with in-room safe, flatscreen TV, coffee maker and fridge on request), friendly and helpful staff. Week wifi signal, but most of the time we had internet access. Noise from the nightclub was minimal and didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay here”
Reviews.Author: one30
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and obviously recently refurbished rooms, friendly staff, free parking, what more can you want. So some reviews mention the noise, well we were facing the nightclub, but nothing the nights we were there, and the bed is very comfortable! Ok so no breakfast but at the price its no problem to go out and there are plenty of options nearby. Easy access to get to and from driving and when you are there, just a couple of blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf and one block from the end of the Powell/Market trolly line.( the only one working at present ). To sum up I don't like giving 5 stars as I reckon there is always room for improvement, but I couldn't see any reason to take any off!

Reviews.Title: “Only one drawback”
Reviews.Author: carlanglas
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great free parking. Major drawback: when there are events at Bimbo's, you have to use ear buds to get some sleep. Very noisy. Wifi signal is too weak to be used with smartphones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gkeim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value. We had a double queen room and stayed there with our 2 kids. The rooms seemed to be fairly recently renovated, beds very comfortable and a huge flat screen TV. It was certainly in a great location, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, famous Lombard Street and Little Italy. There was certainly no shortage of places to eat in the vicinity and we agree with a previous reviewer that Pat's Cafe around the corner was great for breakfast. There was no fridge but there was ice provided down the hall and a coffee machine in the room. Our room was fairly quiet except that it backed onto a nightclub carpark and we did have some noise in the evening from people loading in and out but it certainly didn't upset our stay. A good start for our 3 week visit to the US from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: McInMe
Reviews.Content: This was our destination on a 2-week road trip and we stayed here for 2 nights. Check in was smooth and efficient and we quickly had our keys for the requested 3rd floor room (to reduce the road noise). The room was large, the decor a bit dated. But it was clean and that's most important in my books. Our balcony faced the water and we could see Alcatraz and Coit Tower. The location of the hotel is great! Just 2 blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf and 1 block from the end of the Powell/Market trolly line. The biggest money saver at this hotel is that parking is included. We'd stay here again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular value and locale”
Reviews.Author: janea54
Reviews.Content: I'm almost hesitant to give a San Francisco hotel that only charges $87 night (includes $5 fee for fridge) + tax and offers free parking and is in such a wonderful locale anything less than 5 stars, but there is always room for improvement. I will touch on the only negative for me and then tell you a bit about the highlights. I don't know about you, but I generally don't use hotel bedspreads at night. I pull them back and just sleep under the sheet and blanket. While I'm not a germophobe, I just can't get past the thought that the spreads are rarely cleaned. With that being said, I think CMI should invest in better quality blankets. The one provided was thin and scratchy. We did appreciate the four pillows. Others have touched on the street noise (we were on the 3rd floor facing Columbus). It's a tradeoff, though---get the view such as it is with noise or less noise and face others bldgs I suppose. Our room was spacious with a large flatscreen, handy table and chairs, a French balcony (for standing--not sitting), sink outside bathroom which is handy so no one hogs one area entirely, plentiful towels, large dresser with many drawers, safe in closet, coffee maker with coffee and tea, etc. The garage is part of the building, btw, and it is so easy to access right from the hotel elevator. Others have touched on the proximity to Trader Joe's, Safeway, Pat's Cafe, the wonderful restaurants of North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf along with access to cable cars and BART. We were only in town 2 nights and actually walked everywhere on our list as we've been to SF before and this worked for us. We covered Grace Cathedral, Union Square, and Chinatown all on foot; and we are in our mid-50s! Heh. You just can't go wrong with this place! Save your $ for all the trinkets and tours you will buy. If you're driving, it might not hurt to throw in a blanket or two of your own.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read anymore reviews; just go ahead a book a room!”
Reviews.Author: DanTheContinental
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat! It's a quick walk to the trolley lines. There's a bus stop out front. 10 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz Tours. Free Parking is great too! It's obvious that it's a hotel that's been there a while, but it's not old looking inside. Everything has been redone in the rooms. The beds were nice and comfortable, new crown molding, and a big LG LCD TV mounted on the wall. You can tell that whoever owns this hotel has invested in it and cares about it being excellent. There isn't a pool or breakfast or really too many amenities. But hey, it was exactly what we needed. And at a decent price. Very, very decent for San Fran. Do yourself a favor and just book a room here. Don't look at anymore reviews. ONE CAVEAT: if you're a traveler that expects lots of luxury, amenities, and really likes to spend lots of time at the hotel, you may not like this place. But if you're a traveler that likes to spend as little time at the hotel as possible, sleep well, and be treated nicely, then this place is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but okay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravelBug3
Reviews.Content: Columbus Motor Inn was the cheapest place we could find in San Francisco near Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. The room was comfortable if unspectacular, with a good warm heater. Unfortunately the hotel had no fridge and the internet was dodgy, whist some staff were excellent (Noah) whilst others were less helpful. The great thing about this place was that it was a short walk to the supermarket but more importantly Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, meaning we could explore for dinner, drinks and tours!

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: lisaml1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bargain. It is in a great location. We walked to Fisherman's wharf, and may restaurants and cafes in North Beach. The price is good and it has free parking. That is important. It is hard to find parking in the area sometimes. The room was standard. We were first in a room with no view. Our window opened to a wall, but we asked and they were able to give us a room with a balcony after the first night. It was so much nicer once we got our balcony. The balcony overlooked Columbus St. and there is always people watching to be done there. The only negative was that it seemed that the employees didn't know the area very well. We got bad information a few times. There is a great cafe/bar a block down. The restaurant is called Rico's and the bar/cafe is right next door. They have good omelettes and Mike, the daytime bartender, is great. We loved that place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: greatimes4ever
Reviews.Content: We chose the Columbus based on Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. We arrived hours before checkin and found that our room was available and we were able to head up straight away. What a bonus. The rooms were a good size and they had honoured our request for a room away from the main road. We stayed on a Sunday and Monday night so the nightclub next door was closed, so I can't provide any advice on whether the noise would be an issue. The staff on the front desk were very helpful in providing directions to the places we needed to be. Just a 5-10 minute walk down to Fisherman's Wharf which was very handy and not far away from the stops for the cable car and hop on hop off buses. All in all a great place to stay at a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good price & great location”
Reviews.Author: SATOKUB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Saturday and Sunday in January 2011. Good price for a big clean room with big flat screen TV, big bath room, closet with in-safe (can hold a laptop), coffee maker (with Wolf Gang Puck coffee, pretty good) and free parking. Inside of room/bathroom seemed more updated than the exterior of the place. Only I wish there were mini-fridge, but ice bucket was provided and ice machine was on the every floor. Location is great, 10 minutes leisure walk to Fishermanâ€™s wharf, lots of restaurant in little Italy (which is also 10-15 min walk). Trader Joes, Safeway, drugstore and Star Bucks are 4-5 blocks away on Bay street. Buses run in front of the hotel and 2 blocks away, there is a first stop for cable car. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would be back next time we visit SFO.

Reviews.Title: “consistently good, now with Trader Joe's around the corner”
Reviews.Author: goldenfleese
Reviews.Content: We have a 20 year history staying at the Columbus Inn. It remains a great choice. On this occasion we discovered yet another reason to stay there---a Trader Joe's is now just 3 blocks away at Bay St. and Mason. We bought brie, pate, bread and wine for the room, and even picked up sandwich wraps to take to the airport for the trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Free Parking....Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: kijii
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. Rooms were clean and roomy. Furniture was a bit outdated but functional. Bed was comfortable but we have slept in better. We had a room on the 3rd floor (top floor in building) facing Columbus Ave. and it can be a little noisy traffic wise however it did not bother us too much. The traffic quiets down after 10pm. If you have problems sleeping with street noise reserve a room not facing the street. Housekeepers did a great job cleaning our room. We had asked for extra pillows and a blanket from the housekeeper and she promptly got them for us. Very friendly. I think it is important to note that it is always a good practice to tip the housekeeping staff daily. They work hard and deserve it and you would be surprised on how they will give you a little extra care. Front desk mployees were helpful and friendly. This hotel does not serve breakfast however there is a nice cafe just around the corner, "Pats Place" Great breakfast. The only problem we had was their Internet was not working. Front desk gave me tech support phone number. I called them and they were not able to fix the problem. We also left our car parked in their garage "free parking" for our 3 night stay. We purchased a 3 day Muni Pass ($20.00 per person) which allowed us unlimited use of the buses, cable cars, street cars and Muni underground..Muni als sells 1 day and 7 day passes too. So if you want a nice place to stay, no frills, clean rooms, very close to Fishermans Wharf and San Franciscos great transit system, try this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected .... great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: PeteW60
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights in San Fran as a part of a larger road trip with a rental car so we were looking for a good value, comfortable hotel in a great location with undercover parking. A bit of research on Trip Advisor suggestged that Columbus Motor Inn would fit the bill and it did so perfectly. It is not the fanciest place we stayed in during the trip but the room was large, clean and warm. It is well positioned to walk to entertainment on Fishermans' Wharf. Cable car stop is a short stroll and MUNI bus stops right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sarahtham
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in terms of the distance to tourist spots around. Fisherman's Wharf is only 15 minutes walk away. So its Pier 33 where you would take the Alcatraz tour. Municipal Bus service is half a block away. The rooms are large, really! Clean but deco a little outdated but I am not complaining. Flat screen TV, clean bathrooms. Ur usual coffee making facilities and room safe. Noise level was not bad. Nothing untoward happened but maybe the location of the room may answer that. I had 309 and it was lovely. Again, I cna t say how much I appreciated the space of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place from every angle”
Reviews.Author: gfroch
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location and free parking. Because of the price we didn't expect much. What a surprise! It was clean, great location, wonderful staff. The room wasn't huge, but not small either, fine for the four of us. Not a big lobby, but who hangs out in the lobby! It was far beyond our expectations. We happened by their sister property, I think it was called the Lombard, and they welcomed us like family. Offered us free parking in their lot, gave us directions to some good restaurant choices. I recommend this hotel or Lombard to anyone, especially with a car and/or family.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: debralondon29
Reviews.Content: We were three people in a double queen and the room was large, clean, and comfortable. The decor in room (except for the flat screen tv) was a bit dated but everything else made up for it. The Front desk staff was very helpful. We found the location very convenient to get around from.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: thangstadt
Reviews.Content: After driving from another state to see our Son - his ship was porting in San Francisco - we were tired. We were woke by noise in rooms above us but the front desk did nothing. Finally an object hit our window and knocked the screen off - two separate rooms were throwing objects at the other windows. After yelling to stop I was threatened when they came to my door. Again the front desk considered this a normal night. After all of that at the time of checkout I was charged $40 more than quoted. This was the Worst Hotel Stay Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beaten for location and value”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Columbus Motor Inn, which we booked after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were very impressed with the property, and would highly recommend it as a base for exploring SF. Free parking is available under the building, which was very convenient. The property initially looked a little worn and dated, but our room itself was modern, well appointed and very clean. It was also surprisingly spacious. We requested a room on a high floor away from the road, and both of these requests were met. The room was very quiet as a result of this, and we were able to enjoy great sleeps. The location is excellent, particularly consider the very low cost of our room, and we left the car behind most of the time and easily walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “A few blocks from Little Italy and the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: RamboSacto
Reviews.Content: Good size room on the Columbus Ave side. King size bed, table with 2 wooden chairs, coffee maker, WiFi, wall mounted flat screen w/ cable and a safe. This was a clean place. Maybe a little noisy being on the Columbus Ave but easily livable. What I liked about this place is the location, location, location. We walked to North Beach (Little Italy) and the Wharf. The cable car stop is just a couple of blocks away if you want to do that. Another plus is parking is included. What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: timhallstone
Reviews.Content: I took my wife on a little Christmas trip and we we're going to Cobb's Comedy club and wanted to stay somewhere close without worrying about parking or a taxi.
